intro: Pratia subsessilis, commonly known as the narrow-leaved pratia, is a flowering plant native to Australia. It belongs to the family Myrtaceae and is characterized by its small, narrow leaves and clusters of white or pale yellow flowers. The plant typically grows in coastal regions and is often found in sandy or rocky soils. It is a low-growing shrub that thrives in well-drained conditions and is adapted to salt-laden environments. Pratia subsessilis plays a role in local ecosystems by providing habitat and nectar for native pollinators.
